titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting Motion to Withdraw as Attorney 73. IT IS ORDERED: The Motion to Withdraw (filing 73) is granted. Attorney Amber L. The Clerk shall terminate future notices to Amber L. Abbuhl in this matter. Ordered by Magistrate Judge F.A. Gossett. (TEL)

(AOA)MEMORANDUM AND ORDER - The Defendants' Motion in Limine to Strike Witnesses from the SEC's Nonexpert Witness List and to Limit the Testimony of Steven Henning (Filing No. 156) is denied. The Defendants' Motion in Limine to Exclude Evidence of Subsequent Remedial Measures and Settlement Agreements (Filing No. 160) is granted. The Defendants' Request for Fed. R. Evid. 104 Hearing Regarding the Motion in Limine to Exclude Evidence of Subsequent Remedial Measures and Settlement Agreements (Filing No. 165) is denied as moot. titleInfo.title: Securities and Exchange Commission v. Das et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting 226 Request for Transcript (Non-Party). The Court Reporter will prepare a transcript of the trial relating to the above captioned case that was held on February 14, 2012, through March 1, 2012, and the transcript of the closing arguments held on March 1, 2012, and deliver them to InfoUSA's counsel. InfoUSA will bear and be responsible for all charges connected with preparing the transcripts. Ordered by Chief Judge Laurie Smith Camp. (Copy mailed to counsel for party requesting transcript) (TEL)

titleInfo.title: Securities and Exchange Commission v. Das et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER - The Motion by InfoGroup, Inc., for Leave to File an Amicus Curiae Brief (Filing No. 247) is granted. InfoGroup, Inc., will file its amicus curiae brief on or before May 8, 2012. All parties wishing to respond to the amicus brief filed by InfoGroup, Inc., will do so on or before May 22, 2012. Ordered by Chief Judge Laurie Smith Camp. (TEL)
